pageContext.claim: “But it was a little rigged against him [Bernie Sanders], you know, super delegate, super delegate. She [Hillary Clinton] had so many delegates before the thing even started, I actually said to my people, how does that happen?”
pageContext.analysis: Trump says the system was rigged against Sanders because of the superdelegates. In June 2016, when the media began declaring Clinton the presumptive nominee, Clinton was on track to win the nomination even without superdelegates. We dug into this in depth in a separate fact-check.
